geometry

Class GeometryPoint

  • java.lang.Object
    • scene.SceneElement
      • scene.Point
        • geometry.GeometryPoint

  • public class GeometryPoint
extends Point
    A GeometryPoint facilitates many interaction points in a spirograph. For example, the location a pen might be placed on a wheel, or the location two segments of track are connected can both be represented by GeometryPoints. Because the GeometryPoint inherits from SceneElement, they can be added to the overall scene graph by their encapsulating geometry classes. This allows them to scale, translate, and rotate along with their parent shape. This behavior facilitates spirograph generation.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GeometryPoint(float x, float y)
      Relative location of point on greater geometry.
      GeometryPoint(float angle, float magnitude, boolean isPolar)

    • Constructor Detail

      • GeometryPoint

        public GeometryPoint(float x,
                     float y)
        Relative location of point on greater geometry. 0,0 is the center of the piece.
        Parameters:
        x - is the horizontal coordinate relative to the center.
        y - is the vertical coordinate relative to the center.

      • GeometryPoint

        public GeometryPoint(float angle,
                     float magnitude,
                     boolean isPolar)
        Relative location of point on greater geometry. 0,0 is the center.
        Parameters:
        angle - is the angular component of the polar coordinate
        magnitude - is the value component of the polar coordinate
        isPolar - is a flag parameter, must be supplied to distinguish between the two default params
